title: Simple Steps to Stream Movies on Discord

steps.title: Open your movie's app or in a web browser.
steps.content: Open your movie's app or in a web browser. If you don't have the app (like the Netflix app) open, you won't see it available as a source to add in Discord. If you only complete the first part, you'll most likely see a black screen whenever you attempt to stream a movie. Follow all the steps listed to make sure you have the best streaming experience.

steps.title: Open Discord.
steps.content: Open Discord. Click the app icon that looks like a controller on a light blue background. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click .
steps.content: Click . You'll see this gear icon on the bottom of the Discord window towards the left side of the window. This will open "User Settings."

steps.title: Click Registered Games.
steps.content: Click Registered Games . It's under the "Activity Settings" header in the panel on the left side of the Discord window. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Add it.
steps.content: Click Add it . This is next to the text, "Not seeing your game?" and will prompt a drop-down menu to open.

steps.title: Select your web browser or Netflix app.
steps.content: Select your web browser or Netflix app. You should see any application or program that's running on your laptop. If you don't see your web browser or movie-watching app, relaunch it. Click Add Game to complete this part. Press the ESC key to close User Settings. If you use an app, like the Netflix app, instead of a web browser, you can skip the next part.

steps.title: Open your browser.
steps.content: Open your browser. If you don't turn off hardware acceleration , you'll most likely see a black screen when you stream a movie. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Go to Settings.
steps.content: Go to Settings. The orientation of the three-dot or three-line menu icon changes between vertical and horizontal, but the steps are the same. For any web browser, click the three-dot or three-line menu icon and select Settings.

steps.title: Disable hardware acceleration.
steps.content: Disable hardware acceleration. The steps for this vary depending on your browser, but you can also use the search function to find where "hardware acceleration" is. For Chrome, click System and make sure the toggle next to "Use hardware acceleration when available" is off. For Edge, click System and performance" and make sure the toggle next to "Use hardware acceleration when available" is off. For Firefox, scroll down in the General tab until you see the "Performance" header, then uncheck the box next to "Use recommended performance settings" to see more options. Finally, make sure the box is unchecked next to "Use hardware acceleration when available."

steps.title: Restart your browser.
steps.content: Restart your browser. Once you've relaunched your browser, you can stream a movie without showing a black screen!

steps.title: Go to the movie you want to watch on your web browser.
steps.content: Go to the movie you want to watch on your web browser. Make sure you're using the same browser in which you disabled hardware acceleration!

steps.title: Open Discord and navigate to the channel where you want to stream your movie.
steps.content: Open Discord and navigate to the channel where you want to stream your movie. Click the app icon that looks like a controller on a light blue background, then click the server and then the channel that you want to stream in. [4] X Research source Since you can't screen share in text channels, make sure to join a voice channel, which is identified by an icon of a speaker.

steps.title: Click the screen share icon.
steps.content: Click the screen share icon. This icon looks like a screen with a video camera in the top right corner. It's above the User Settings gear icon. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Choose your stream settings.
steps.content: Choose your stream settings. By default, 720p resolution and 30 fps is selected. If you want to stream with higher quality, you'll have to pay to unlock Discord Nitro. Make sure the correct channel that you want to stream to is selected in the first drop-down.

steps.title: Click Go Live.
steps.content: Click Go Live . Anything in the selected app or in your web browser will show up for everyone else to see. Your friends can join you by right-clicking your username in the chat and selecting "Watch livestream."
